summary: This is an email chain from October 28, 2019, discussing scheduling confusion for a meeting involving Mark Epstein. The participants include an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and an attorney representing a client flying in from Florida. The meeting was originally set for October 28 but was rescheduled to October 31.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: The email chain is about scheduling a meeting concerning him; he is the brother of Jeffrey Epstein and was reportedly flying in from Florida for the meeting.

events.title: Scheduled meeting missed
events.description: A meeting concerning Mark Epstein was originally confirmed for October 28 at 3:00 p.m. but did not occur due to scheduling conflicts and confusion.

events.title: Rescheduled meeting
events.description: The meeting concerning Mark Epstein was rescheduled to October 31 at 3:00 p.m. after confusion over the original date.

keyFacts: Mark Epstein was flying from Florida to New York for a meeting with legal authorities in October 2019.
An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York was involved in scheduling the meeting.
There was confusion and miscommunication about the meeting date, originally set for October 28 but rescheduled to October 31.
The email chain indicates ongoing legal or investigative proceedings involving Mark Epstein following his brother Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
